column4: Are there some easy, more or less user-friendly way to share ntfs drive?
you mean set up a samba share? or share btween os's ?
i just install samba and make a proper entry for it in the smb.conf  samba is the kind of tool thats worth learning well
yup, I know the different admin-ways. Two of them really.
Question is: if there are some user-friendly way I can explain to non-admins

depends on what/how they want  to do shares. for sahreing stuff out of their own home dir. theres some share feature on the rioght click menu. PROBLEM with shareing a ntfs drive. is that you may need to tweak the permissions on the drive. and mount it via fstab  Not let it 'auto mount on access'
as far as I understand, there are no GUI way to modify the owner of the mounted disk?
its best to just make a proper entry in the fstab.. dependin on how you want it owned.
every ftab ediing gui ive ever seen.. had limitations/issues.. and i ended up just doing it by hand anyway
well, yes, it's common situation...hmmm...ok, anyway, thanks.
untill not so long ago the use of ntfs-3g was very UNCOMMON. :)
there is the ntfs-config tool that can add fstab entries i belive fro  ntfs/vfat filesystems
yes, I installed it manually in some earlier ubuntu version
but addin NTFS support REALLY helps to people to make decision to try ubuntu
its been argued both ways and across the world ways..  ntfs-config tool does allow you do do a few clicks and enable full access to ntfs filesystems.   Or not allow any at all.
personally during the install - i give my ntfs fs's a mountpoint so its rarely an issue for me.
you mean, your NTFS volumes are hard-mounted?
i have entries for them in fstab, eitehr made by the installer, or by the ntfs-config tool.  if thats what yiou mean.
